Fields.DialogueText: We're under attack! Quickly, to your stations!
Anshinshite, Kanchou. Watashi zenbu makasete kudasai! No one will be dying today. Not if I have anything to say about it!
@BATTLE
That was quite the display.
Arigatō gozaimasu, Kanchou. I really do feel as though I have been given a fresh set of wings on the battlefield, thanks to your encouragment.
Still living up to the phoenix name, haha!
As fond as I am of the lore of the Phoenix, it only reincarnates in Greek mythology. We have different ideas where I come from.
Is that so?
Lots of ways! Luck, peace, rebirth... Would you like to hear about any one in particular?

Fields.MenuText: Luck.

Fields.DialogueText: Sighting a Hō-ō is said to bring one great fortune. In some areas of Japan, a sighting is even said to grant one's deepest wishes!

Fields.MenuText: Peace.

Fields.DialogueText: It's said that during times of war, the phoenix will flee to the heavens, only to return during peacetime.
I suppose I'm not much like a phoenix in that regard, but I hope my presence on the battlefield can inspire the crew toward future peace.

Fields.MenuText: Rebirth.

Fields.DialogueText: Unlike the Greek bird who physically rises from its own ashes, the sighting of a Hō-ō is said to represent the birth of a new era. One may spot a Hō-ō circling the birth of a new and prosperous ruler.
How interesting. It looks like I still have a lot of studying to do in order to keep up with you.
I would be more than happy to discuss things further. I do very much enjoy these kinds of conversations.
Maybe some other time. For now, I need you in my quarters to go over our next assignment. After you've finished up here, please come and see me.
Wakarimashita!
You wanted to see me, Kanchou?
Yes, please have a seat. We've received our next mission directive. The higher-ups were very impressed with your perseverance when rescuing our stranded captain.
I did no more than any good-willed sailor would do.
Still, it seems you left a good impression. We've been tasked with another defensive operation.
If I can spend my war days protecting the innocent from harm, I would be able to live out my retirement at ease. I'm all for it, Kanchou.
That's good to hear. We'll be escorting a rather large convoy ship through Morgana territory. The ship has some defensive capabilities, but these will be saved for a last-ditch attempt at survival.
Hai!

Fields.MenuText: Any questions?

Fields.DialogueText: Iie. Demo, I still cannot believe that someone like me is worthy of praise. Considering my less than stellar history, it is nice that my effort to improve is being recognized.

Fields.MenuText: Are you happy with such a passive mission?

Fields.DialogueText: Hai! Unlike other Kami, I have no longing to engage in bloodshed. Much like our convoy ship, I would only engage an enemy as a last resort.

Fields.MenuText: Retirement planning can wait. You've got to make history first.

Fields.DialogueText: This is true. But I cannot wait to enjoy a nice refreshing dip in an onsen once this is all said and done! Sea water and bath water just cannot compare!
*ALARM*
Morganas! That's all for today, Hōshō. Please handle the intruders and take some rest.
Hai!
@BATTLE
How goes the preparation for our next mission, Hōshō? Are you nearly ready to go?
Hai, mō sugu. I will be returning to the battlefield again, it seems...

Fields.MenuText: You're not fond of war?

Fields.DialogueText: Henna shitsumon, Kanchou! Is there any living creature who would be?

Fields.MenuText: Pacifism is not a language the Morganas understand.

Fields.DialogueText: Tasshikani. That is why I will do all that I can to ensure peace for future generations.

Fields.MenuText: The phoenix is an entirely docile creature, is it not?

Fields.DialogueText: As I mentioned, the presence of a phoenix is one meant to symbolize the end of carnage. It may take some time, but I hope my presence can have the same effect.
Well, I for one am glad you do not retreat into the heavens whenever a battle breaks out.
Sōdesune. As long as I am free to rest in my quarters, I can continue onwards.
Speaking of which, is your room in the same... state... we found it in last time?
I'd rather not discuss such private matters, but if you feel so inclined, I would permit you to view it one more time.
*ALARM*
Let's deal with these Morganas and then I'll head over.
Hai!
@BATTLE
Forgive me, I had to get some air. I had forgotten just how chaotic those quarters were...
Hidoi desu, Kanchou...

Fields.MenuText: Is such a place really that relaxing?

Fields.DialogueText: I enjoy the freedom. I don't have to worry about keeping up appearances in fear that I may be retired early. I can do whatever I want.

Fields.MenuText: How can you find anything in there?

Fields.DialogueText: I have a very elaborate system, thank you very much! Clothes are thrown to the right and everything else is thrown to the left!

Fields.MenuText: How long has it been like that?

Fields.DialogueText: For as long as I can remember.
I see. And how about that box we found while exploring?
Hai, I can't remember what's inside.
And that lock looks mighty stubborn. What say we just break it apart?
Dame desu, Kanchou! Such an expertly painted wooden box should not be destroyed so easily!
The key has to be somewhere in your room. My curiosity is getting the better of me. Would you grant me permission to clean your room in search of the key?
I will not turn down a free maid service!
*ALARM*
We'll be docking soon. We can pick up a few supplies to clean the room while we're there.
Hai! Please get started with the list while I deal with the Funayūrei!
@BATTLE
Okay, so, what do we need? Bleach, trash bags. A flamethrower...
Hm? What was that?
Nothing!
While we're here, Kanchou, perhaps you would be inclined to upgrade our firepower.
Hm?
If we are to defend an entire convoy by ourselves, we might need to take down several fleets of Funayūrei.
Unless that wooden box has a few hundred diamonds inside, I think we'll have to pass on big purchases for a while.
Alas, even I am not so messy-minded to forget something of such value.
*ALARM*
I heard that all the way from out here!
We must have been tailed! Hayaku, let's return to the ship at once!
@BATTLE
It's a tempting thought, but-

Fields.MenuText: I've already checked. There's nothing here of really great practical value to us.
I'm more worried about soap and toothpaste supplies. Your armaments are in good shape.
Right now the *last* thing I want to do is bring more clutter onto this ship.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah. I should have known you'd have thought of it already!
I'll prepare the requisition forms immediately, Kanchou.
Pardon me?
Joking.
More generally, there's also the question of expense. I don't have a lot of political strings to pull out here at the moment.
After all that cleaning, we still couldn't find anything!
At least my quarters are positively spotless now...

Fields.MenuText: You don't look too pleased about that.

Fields.DialogueText: Iie, I really appreciate your hard work, Kanchou. It's just...

Fields.MenuText: Do you have any idea where it could be?

Fields.DialogueText: Not a clue. For all I know, I may have never been in possession of it. The box could have been given to me already locked. I just can't remember.

Fields.MenuText: Can you keep it that way?

Fields.DialogueText: That's the thing...
I don't know if I'll be able to keep my quarters in such pristine condition. I can feel the stress mounting.
Why's that?
I'll be forced to keep it clean so as not to disappoint you. Your efforts will be squandered if I let the room fall into disarray again...
In that case, I will offer my cleaning services to you once a week.
Kanchou?
Live how you will Monday to Saturday. Then, when Sunday night falls, I will venture forth with bucket and mop into no man's land.
You would do such a thing for me? Even though I'm being so unreasonable?
Of course. I'd do anything to keep you smiling.
Kanchou...
*ALARM*
Morganas! Are you ready?
Hai!
@BATTLE
We should be meeting with the captain of the convoy ship any moment now.
Hold on a second! Out there! I believe that's him trying to dock!
With a horde of Funayūrei in tow! We must help him!
@BATTLE
Phew! You really saved our bacon out there. Looks like whoever hired you to protect us was right to do so.
No thanks are necessary. We're just doing our job.
All well and good. Feel free to give us our orders. We'll be in you care after all.
Ano... etto... Kanchou! What do you think we should--?

Fields.MenuText: The captain didn't ask me. He asked his savior.

Fields.DialogueText: Sōdesune... People are relying on me to make the right call...

Fields.MenuText: *Wink*

Fields.DialogueText: Right... right... this will be part of my legacy as well, it seems.

Fields.MenuText: I'm right behind you.

Fields.DialogueText: Eh?! Placing the lives of so many men in my hands is too much pressure! How do you sleep at night without worry, Kanchou?!
Please take the lead. We will follow closely behind.
The lead? Are you sure?
I... Kan... I'm sure, please believe in me.
If you say so. You heard the lady! Get this hunk of scrap ready for takeoff!
Kanchou, we should get ready as well.
You're the boss.
Things seem to be going well so far. Nary a Funayūrei in sight.
You seemed a little hesitant to enforce your orders on our stubborn captain over there.
My service history is less than stellar, especially when compared to some of the other Japanese Kami. I can't help but doubt myself.

Fields.MenuText: Have you always felt this way?

Fields.DialogueText: Not at all! In my prime, I may have been able to bark orders without a second thought. However, with age comes wisdom. I can't help but reflect on my mistakes.

Fields.MenuText: Try not to think on your mistakes so much.

Fields.DialogueText: How should I learn from my mistakes if I do not dwell on them? Constantly... without remorse... sinking deeper and deeper into regret and despair...

Fields.MenuText: I allowed your plan to go ahead. Are you questioning my judgment too?

Fields.DialogueText: Definitely not! I just hope everything goes okay.
Your quick thinking has gotten us out of so many tricky situations in the past. I trust your judgment more than anyone.
With those words cheering me on, how can I not try my best?! I will trust my reasoning. I believed that it would be optimal for us to take up the rear spot in case of a-- MITE!
Morganas! Looks like they were trying to ambush us!
If I had wallowed in self-doubt any longer, we would have been taken completely by surprise!
Ahead too! They're trying to pincer us!
It's okay, Kanchou. We've seen the attack coming! The element of surprise has been ripped away from our enemies!
To your positions!
@BATTLE
Quickly! Move your ship to safety. We'll provide cover fire and a smokescreen!
Ryōkai!
@BATTLE
That looks to be the last of them...
And the convoy ship is still in perfect health!

Fields.MenuText: How did you manage to take on such a fleet?

Fields.DialogueText: Normally, it would be impossible while also trying to protect another vessel. Luckily, thanks to our noticing of the ambush, the captain had time to slip into the shadows and free up my playground!

Fields.MenuText: Your plan saved us.

Fields.DialogueText: Hazukashii, Kanchou! Iwanaide kudasai! I require no praise for trying my hardest to keep everyone alive. Atarimae desho?

Fields.MenuText: That surly captain should eat his words!

Fields.DialogueText: I'm happy letting that victory go. As long as we all return healthy and happy, I can sleep easy.
Did you deal with them all?!
Hai! They've all been taken out. Thank you for quickly responding to our instructions.
The first pit stop is within sight. Let's reconvene on land!
Apologies, Kanchou. We should have had the foresight to predict an ambush. Had we done so, we could have spared you such distress.
Don't worry about all that. I'm just glad to be alive! I should be the one saying sorry for doubting you.

Fields.MenuText: Well, isn't that nice, Hōshō? Anything you have to say?

Fields.DialogueText: Ah! Dōitashimashite!

Fields.MenuText: I'm lucky to have her.

Fields.DialogueText: You've got yourself a fine companion there. Make sure you keep hold of her.

Fields.MenuText: We look forward to working with you more in the future.

Fields.DialogueText: I feel safer already!
We'll be heading back onto the ship now. Several Funayūrei look to be circling the outside waters. Best you take them out before we proceed.
Leave it to us.
@BATTLE
We must make sure to be prepared for all possibilities from here on out, Kanchou. We won't be that lucky every time.
I thought phoenixes were supposed to bring luck to those who see them.
And in an attempt to live up to my namesake, I use my good luck charms to boost my potential. I fear that without them, I would be of no luck whatsoever.

Fields.MenuText: How many charms have you got now?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sure. It definitely surpasses double digits.

Fields.MenuText: Do they work?

Fields.DialogueText: The fact that I am still standing here alive should be evidence enough that they must be doing something right.

Fields.MenuText: Must you live up to your namesake? I think you're doing fine as is.

Fields.DialogueText: I have a lot to prove in hopefully very little time. Still, I appreciate you giving me the chance at least to do some good.
I think you're luckier than you realize.
I'm still having a hard time accepting that our escape from the Funayūrei fleet was not plain luck.
Shall we put it to the test?
How do you...? Ah, Ii desu yo! I'm always prepared for such a furious battle.
*ALARM*
Let's start our fight after the Morganas are dealt with.
Hai!
@BATTLE
Are you ready?
As I'll ever be!
Saisho wa gū...
Janken pon!

Fields.MenuText: [Throw Gū]
[Throw Paa]
[Throw Choki]

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! Paa! I win!
Ha! Choki! I win!
Ha! Gū! I win!
That proves nothing! This could be nothing more than a coincidence!
Weren't you the one trying to prove my luck, Kanchou? I think you are just irritated that you lost.
Let's go again.
Kamawanai! Aiko desho!
*ALARM*
Rock, Paper, Scissors, Morgana seems a little one-sided, does it not?
You forgot to include the Morgana counter, Kanchou! A primed Kami ready for battle!
@BATTLE
Kanchou? You wanted to see me? What is all this?
I've gathered most of the crew here to put my speculation to rest. There is no conceivable way for you to beat every person here in Janken without some kind of magical ability.
Kanchou... Hazukashii desu yo...
This is no time for embarrassment! Let's see just how lucky you really are!
*ALARM*
Shouldn't that be evidence enough of my lack of good luck?
@BATTLE
Janken pon!
Ah! Kachimashita. Sumimasen!
Sugi!
Janken pon!
Gomennasai matta kachimashita!

Fields.MenuText: You men are an embarrassment!

Fields.DialogueText: Don't blame the crew, Kanchou! This is essentially out of our control!

Fields.MenuText: You have to be cheating!

Fields.DialogueText: How dare you, Kanchou! I have never once cheated at anything in my entire life!

Fields.MenuText: Why do you keep apologizing?!

Fields.DialogueText: Shikataganai! The crew look so upset when they lose...
*100 OR SO DEFEATED CREW LATER*
That does it. If you want something done right, you have to do it yourself. Please allow me one final rematch.
Kanchou... Why are you so fired up...?
Never in all my years at sea; through countless siren sightings, kraken shadows beneath the waves, and storms conjured by Poseidon himself...
... Have I ever been more convinced that something supernatural is occuring on this ship!
*Sigh* Very well. In that case, let us play our final...
*Whisper whisper* How great is this? With Hōshō's power of luck, we can't possibly lose a fight!
*Whisper whisper* I know! It's like traveling with a god beside you!
Hōshō? Are you ready?
Hai? Ah, hai, ikimashō!
Saisho wa gū!
Janken!
Pon!
Kanchou? You wanted to see me?
Please take a seat.
Is something the matter?
Why did you let me win?
Hai?
I could see it in your eyes. You threw later than usual. You saw my hand moving and deliberately chose the wrong option.
*Sigh* I've been found out...
Why?
If I were to win, the crew would become complacent. Luck is always a godsend when it favors you but it should never be relied upon.

Fields.MenuText: The crew were awfully intrigued by your skill at Janken.

Fields.DialogueText: It was nothing but a coincidence.

Fields.MenuText: You don't believe yourself to be lucky?

Fields.DialogueText: No more than anyone else.

Fields.MenuText: Then why do you carry so many good luck charms?

Fields.DialogueText: My good luck charms are only meant to boost our odds of success.
To multiply those odds, we still need to have at least 1% of effort as a base for the charms to have any effect, no? Zero times zero is still zero.
I've grown rather attached to my charms over the years. Had my feelings been different, I may have held onto them forever.
But?
Standing beside you, I cannot help but feel like the luckiest Kami in the ocean. I think I would find it more cathartic to give them away to the crew!
I feel the same way. Let's do it!
*ALARM*
We can't get luckier than having free target practice!
I was thinking the same thing!
@BATTLE
This will be our final stop before the last spurt. We should make sure everything is present and accounted for before heading out.
We could also take this time to hand out your charms to the crew. I'm sure they'll be happy to receive any kind of morale boost at such a pivotal juncture.
Are we all ready to go?
Almost, Kanchou. Please accept this as a token of good fortune.
I'm not much for jewelry.
Onegaishimasu! May it watch over and protect you throughout your journey.
Hm... It is a rather nice looking pendant. Sure, what the hell!
Kanshashimasu! Please head back to your ship and we will clear out any Funayūrei obstructing our exit!
Much obliged.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: You've already checked and double-checked. We're ready.
Agreed.
Maybe finish your tea first.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah. Good thought. *sip*
That said... we could take a few minutes to hand out your charms to the crew. I'm sure they'll be happy to receive any kind of morale boost at such a pivotal juncture.
You there, keep an eye on the convoy ship! Make sure several crewmen are stationed at the rear! The cannons should all be loaded and ready to fire at a moment's notice!

Fields.MenuText: You've really come into your own, Hōshō.

Fields.DialogueText: What was that, Kanchou? Gomennasai, I'm a little preoccupied.
Nothing. Don't mind me. Please continue.

Fields.MenuText: Is there anything I can do, Hōshō?

Fields.DialogueText: Hm? You are still the kanchou, Kanchou. I'm sure you can keep yourself busy.

Fields.MenuText: Do you expect another ambush?

Fields.DialogueText: Not necessarily. But if one does come, we will be more than ready!
*ALARM*
Kimashita! It seems these Funayūrei have only one tactic. Lucky for us, we are more than prepared. Please move to cover again, Kanchou!
Aye-aye!
Kanchou, with me!
@BATTLE
They're nearly felled!
Mada, mada! Don't let up until the last ship sinks beneath the waves!
@BATTLE
*KAW KAW*
Tsukaremashita!
Otsukare, Hōshō.
Arigatō gozaimasu, Kanchou. I could not have done it without your continued support.

Fields.MenuText: I'm really proud of you.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou... Nani iitendayo...

Fields.MenuText: You continue to amaze me.

Fields.DialogueText: You don't need to say so much...

Fields.MenuText: What a legacy you will leave!

Fields.DialogueText: Do you really think so? That makes me so happy...
Quickly, let us cement our victory by reaching the port.
Hai!
We made it! You crazy sons of... We actually made it!
Is the convoy damaged at all?
Not a scratch. We have you to thank for it. You are one lucky Kami.
Much apprec--
Luck had nothing to do with it. It was a well executed plan concocted by a seasoned war veteran.
Kanchou...
Please continue to do your utmost for the war effort!
You too, ship lady. I'm proud to have worked beside you. Oh, by the way...
Hai?
While we fled from the Funayūrei, I had ample time to fiddle with my new pendant. Turns out, the main part of it opens up. This was inside.
Kagi da?!
I don't know if it means anything to you, but I thought I'd return it nevertheless. You two take care now.
Hontōni arigatō gozaimasu. Kanchou, hayaku, hayaku!
Let's get back onto the ship and await further orders. I'm sure we can keep busy while opening that damned wooden box!
@BATTLE
Well, I think you're on to something there. And I know we wouldn't be around without you - we're in your debt.

Fields.MenuText: Just doing our jobs.
We take cash.
Ah, it was fun.

Fields.DialogueText: *ahem*
Sorry.
This is it...
The moment of truth...
I just want to clarify, Kanchou, that I in no way expect this to be filled with the riches of a thousand kings. In all likelihood, it could be nothing more than hairpins.
*ALARM*
Gah! Morganas! Let's deal with them first. I want no distractions while we open this.
@BATTLE
A flute?
Ah! Oboemashita! I was given this when I awakened. I've been so busy I haven't had time to play.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't know you played the flute.

Fields.DialogueText: There's a lot you still don't know about me, Kanchou. Feel free to ask more questions as they come to you.

Fields.MenuText: You've played your whole life?

Fields.DialogueText: As long as I can remember. Music soothes the soul and, if my naval history is anything to go by, my soul is in need of a lot of soothing...

Fields.MenuText: It doesn't look much like an ordinary flute.

Fields.DialogueText: It's made of bamboo. It's known as a dizi and it comes from China.
Will you play me something?
I would be happy to!
What a beautiful melody. You truly are a Belle of many talents.
It's nothing, Kanchou. One day I would like to play as well as my contemporaries, but I lack the discipline.

Fields.MenuText: Where did you learn to play?

Fields.DialogueText: I taught myself. That's likely why I'm not that good.

Fields.MenuText: It sounds like birdsong.

Fields.DialogueText: I try my best to make the sounds as pleasant as possible. If they sound even slightly similar to birdsong, I call that an accomplishment.

Fields.MenuText: So it isn't only your room that bears the brunt of your lack of motivation.

Fields.DialogueText: The war requires my undivided attention. Until it ends, I cannot focus on things I'd like to.
Perhaps, if we played your flute on the deck, Tori would catch wind and come home for a visit.
What an excellent idea, Kanchou! Let us head upstairs at once!
*ALARM*
Perfect timing! We can handle the Funayūrei on our way!
@BATTLE
This should be a good spot.

Fields.MenuText: What tune will you play to summon him?

Fields.DialogueText: Tori and I would often sing together in my quarters. I can remember his favorite melody, so I'll play that.

Fields.MenuText: I wonder if he'll hear us...

Fields.DialogueText: He'll hear, Kanchou. Anshinshite kudasai.

Fields.MenuText: Good luck.

Fields.DialogueText: Omoshirokunai, Kanchou! We've done away with that part of our adventure!
*MELODIC FLUTE MUSIC*
Did it work?
*ALARM*
Yappari! I really am unlucky! All my tune managed to do was summon a fleet of Funayūrei!
No time for sulking! Let's take them out!
@BATTLE
That should be the last of them.
I won't lie - a small part of me had hoped Tori would fly in to support us.
Tori has his own life now. We can't expect him to call home as much as we'd like.

Fields.MenuText: You make us sound like his parents.

Fields.DialogueText: P-parents? *Ahem* I've no time to think about such things when the war is at our doorstep! Please focus on your naval duties, Kanchou!

Fields.MenuText: They grow up so fast.

Fields.DialogueText: I did all I could for him. The rest is in his... wings.

Fields.MenuText: We'll meet him again someday.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai! I'm sure of it!
At the very least, he will always have a safe haven to return to in times of trouble.
A safe haven... right...
Something the matter?
@BATTLE
Keep them at bay! Tori has no way of landing in such a chaotic frenzy!
Will you come with me? I wish to speak privately.
Of course. Lead the way.
Was it really necessary for us to journey all the way down here?
I would rather no one hear what I'm about to say.
What you're about to... *Ahem* R-right... Then I won't stand in your way...
I've been thinking about this for some time now. I can no longer keep these feelings inside.

Fields.MenuText: Should I be worried?
Should I be scared?
Should I be excited?

Fields.DialogueText: Potentially. I'm quite worried myself.
I've never been more scared to say something in my life.
My butterflies are in full frenzy, so I would ask yours to do the same.
Just let me have it...
Okay, here it goes... I like living in a dirty room!
I would love to!
Hai...?
... Hear more of what you're going to say... I would love to...
As much as I appreciate you cleaning my room, I did not leave it in such a condition out of laziness. I want to have a space not dominated by formality.
I see.
I didn't want to reject your kindness, but now I'm at a loss as to what should be done next...
There's only one thing for it.
*ALARM*
We rough up these Morganas - and after that, your room's next!
@BATTLE
Meccha tanoshikatta, Kanchou!
I haven't laughed that much in years!
Demo, watashi no heya ga kawaisō!
It never saw the rampage coming!
Arigatō, Kanchou.
For what?
For allowing me to live without worry. I can be myself around you, and... that's all I've ever wanted.

Fields.MenuText: You didn't use "gozaimasu."

Fields.DialogueText: We've been together for some time now. I thought I could drop the formality at least around you... Dame?

Fields.MenuText: You never need to put on airs around me.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai, I'm starting to realize that more and more each day.

Fields.MenuText: I want to know even more about you.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou... Yarisuginai...?
*ALARM*
Kanchou, please come with me to the deck. There is something I would like to give you. I will handle the Morganas so please make your way up once the coast is clear.
@BATTLE
Kanchou! I told you to wait until it was safe!
How could I leave you alone?! We're a team!
Sōdesune! Jya, yoroshiku onegaishimasu!
@BATTLE
Kanchou... Dozō!

Fields.MenuText: A present?

Fields.DialogueText: A token of my appreciation!

Fields.MenuText: I feel like a schoolboy on Valentine's day receiving chocolate.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope this can evoke the same feelings of happiness!

Fields.MenuText: For me?

Fields.DialogueText: Hai! Considering there is no one else around I hoped that would have been obvious!
It's the same wooden box your flute was inside.
That's right. But I have fitted it with a new lock. See?
So, what's inside?
Before I hand you the key, I need to ask you... How do you feel about me?

Fields.MenuText: You are someone very special to me.
You are someone I care about deeply.
You are much more than a crewmate or even a friend.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmm... Mada desu!
Huh? Not yet? I'm lost.
I have found my courage to speak my truth on the battlefield, Kanchou. When you find your voice, please come and speak with me again. At that time, I will happily unlock the box.
I... I see... You'll wait for me?
Mochiron! Although we may have to clean my room again, as I threw the key inside the mess without looking. That way, I can't be temped to open it for you earlier!
I'll gladly help you clean it whenever you want. I'll be by your side for as long as you'll permit me.
Hai! Onegaishimasu, Kanchou!
